text: Pours virtually black with a creamy, fluffy off-white head that subsides to a creamy head and lingers. Aroma is chocolate with hints of banana. Taste is banana chocolate sweet, hints of fudge, with a twist of clove and increasing bitterness going into the finish. Texture is chewy, a bit oily, on a robust body.
Bottle at BrewMasters Craft Beer Festival. Pours a cloudy brown with medium beige head. The aroma is roast, pepper, yeast. Medium body, creamy, roast, dark chocolate, dry finish, very good.
Outstanding dark beer regardless of the name. I wish I could make a beer like this at home. Not really what I like in a wiessbier, but this is great all the same.
Pours deep brown with a tan head. Aroma is ripe banana and dark wheat. Tastes like a dunkel. Medium body.
Drinking straight from the bottle after a day at the beach with kids and the in-laws. A dark hefe which spurred some curiosity. Little heavy for this heat and humidity but could be stronger
Bottled, dark murky color, some tan foam, nice earthy chocolate nose, a bit chalky flavor of chocolate, plum, earth and wine, good finish, finally got to try this in SA.
This is a really nice dunkelweizen. Pours dark, the flavor is mildly roasty, has some burned caramel and spice. Gift from Emma when she moved from Texas in 2016.

12 oz. bottle. Pours a very dark brown with a large beige fizzy head that quickly retreats. Aroma is banana, along with faint chocolate and roasted malt. Taste is banana, bubble gum, clove, chocolate and roasted malt. I guess the combination works okay; its not something unacceptable (to me) like a sour porter, but I wouldnt go out of my way seeking it out.

A dark beer with a tan head. Sampled on draught in San Antonio. Spicy, with notes of banana and bubblegum, exactly as in the deScription. Delicious and highly drinkable. Some roasted notes and a mildly bitter finish. Unusual to taste a black Hefe, but definitely worth sampling.

Austin, Tx - on tap at Whole Foods - Lamar St. Dark black frothy head, khaki colored head, thick lace. Bananas and  clove in the aroma. Full bodied flavor with, some coriander cloves and banana, rubbery finish.  Decently thick mouthfeel.
Draft. The hefe had the goodness of a traditional hefeweizen - wheat, spices and banana - with the favor of a good porter (chocolate and toasted malt). Very enjoyable.

Dark deb brownish amber with a foamy and sticky ivory head. Roasty and wheaty aroma with a little kiss of banana. Smooth, quaffable and balanced body with some semisweet earthy roasted meat, gently caramelized wheat malt, and a dry earhy finish with notes of wheat and roast. Semisweet overall, and basically tastes like its moniker--a black hefe. Pretty interesting.

Pours black in the glass. Spicy cloves and banana aroma with a hint of smoky char. Banana and bitter dark chocolate flavor notes. I also get a hint of some spice too. Overall, much better than expected. Good execution.

Bottle. Pours a deep, deep brownish-black with only a ring head. Nose is a chocolate-banana milk shake, along with the clove one expects from a traditional hefe. Not much sweetness on the palate; very traditional hefe notes, along with a smoky baking chocolate and oolong tea element. Not too heavy, which is nice; suitable for Texas. Finish is long with a little treacly sweetness. Easy to drink; mild. Good.
Very dark brown with a beige head. Aroma of bubblegum, banana, spices, and cocoa. Taste is semi-sweet Cocoa and yeast. Light-medium bodied.
On tap at Wurstfest in New Braunfels, TX. Black in color with an average off-white head. Aroma is of banana, clove, light toast, caramel. Taste is of wheat, roasted malts, banana, clove, chocolate.
Tap at Wurstfest. The look is dark, brownish colored, with beige to tan head. The smell is banana, yeast, fruity, wheat, cocoa, decent. The taste is wheat, fruit, cocoa, and not bad.

Aromas of banana and cloves. Pours a dark brown with a short-lived off white head and no lacing. The taste is bananas, cloves, roasted malts, with a touch of smoke and chocolate. Medium body and soft carbonation. Overall, I liked the combination of dark malts and bananas.
sample from bottle at 2014 houston big brew fest. Hazy blackish with small head. Unique hefeweizen with a chocolate malt base. Interesting. Banana comes through well, but not much spicing.
Delicious banana on the nose, smooth and well balanced with the chocolate and imparted by toasty dark malts
Pours very dark with a thin tan cap. Aroma is faint banana and smoke. Tastes like a chocolate covered banana thats been roasted over an open flame.
